name: 808Melo
description: '''Andre Michael Loblack''' (born 6 April 1997), known professionally as '''808Melo''' or '''808MeloBeats''', is an [[English people|English]] record producer and songwriter. 808Melo is credited as a pioneer of [[UK drill]] and [[Brooklyn drill]] and is known for his bass heavy percussion. In 2019, he produced [[Pop Smoke]]'s debut mixtape, ''[[Meet the Woo]]''. He also produced most of the songs on [[Pop Smoke]]'s sophomore mixtape, ''[[Meet the Woo 2]]'', and he helped produce Pop Smoke's posthumous album ''[[Shoot for the Stars, Aim for the Moon]]'', which topped the ''Billboard'' Hot 100 artist charts in July 2020. 808Melo has also produced songs for [[Travis Scott]], [[Fivio Foreign]], and [[Lil Tjay]].
